Pre-Game Insights: England are defending a global title, but unlike their ODI World Cup performance, Jos Buttler's T20 outfit looks fit and firing.
England have never yet beaten a European nation at the T20 World Cup, having lost to Netherlands in 2009 and 2014, and having the worst of two rain-affected clashes against Ireland in 2010 and 2022.
Jos Buttler became England's most-capped player and first man to score 3000 runs in T20Is during the series against Pakistan.
Moeen Ali needs two more wickets to reach 50 in T20Is.
Scotland romped into the 2024 event with six wins out of six in the regional qualifiers in Edinburgh, including a table-topping clincher against Ireland in their final game.

England's recent experience of the Caribbean came in a six-laden showdown with the hosts in December, and anything that knocks their hard-hitting batters off their stride can only be a bonus for the underdogs.
Scotland's left-arm seamer Mark Watt has the pedigree to perform a similarly constrictive role as Gudakesh Motie in the series decider in Tarouba last year.
England are trying not to play the game before the game has been played and would be ready to adapt to conditions.

It feels like a real World Cup, lots of teams involved. There are never any easy games. Every game we have to be right on it and match the intensity required for the game. All we are focused on is that Scotland match. That is the biggest and most important thing right now.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The strip in Barbados is the same that was used for Namibia's low-scoring thriller against Oman, a slow and sticky surface in which 109 played 109 until David Wiese got busy in the Super Over.
Scotland's experience from the last two T20 World Cups, with plenty of experience and a strong squad, could be beneficial in the match.
The match will be the 2637th in the format's history, and just their sixth in total, after five previous ODIs up to and including a particularly notable result six years ago.
Scotland's left-arm seamer Brad Currie, who made headlines with his fielding in the Blast, is a new addition to the squad.
The match will be played at the Kensington Oval in Barbados, a venue that could be a leveller in the first T20 meeting between England and Scotland.
England's Jos Buttler and Phil Salt will be looking to go hard from the very first ball, with Buttler's forceful best and Salt's Jason Roy-like ability to go hard from the top of the order.
The match will be a big test for England's ability to adapt to conditions, with the strip in Barbados being a slow and sticky surface.
Scotland's experience in playing on slow and sticky surfaces could be beneficial in the match.
The match will be a significant opportunity for Scotland to prove themselves against a strong England team.
England's Jofra Archer has a shot at catharsis in the match, as he will be playing an international on his home island of Barbados in front of his friends and family.
The match will be a big test for England's ability to overcome the challenge of Scotland's left-arm spinners, with Mark Watt and Brad Currie being two of the most experienced players in the squad.
The match will be a significant opportunity for Scotland to prove themselves against a strong England team and make a statement in the tournament.
Others: The match will be played on June 4, 2024, at the Kensington Oval in Barbados.
The match will be the 6th match of the group stages of the T20 World Cup 2024.
The match will be a significant test for England's ability to adapt to conditions and overcome the challenge of Scotland's left-arm spinners.
The match will be a big test for Scotland's ability to prove themselves against a strong England team and make a statement in the tournament.
The match will be a significant opportunity for England to continue their title defence and prove themselves as a strong team in the tournament.
